head.supplied: Mortons Hotel ¶ Millswyn Street, ¶ S. Yarra, ¶ 28/11/74 ¶ ¶ I feel honored with your kind lines, dear Mr. Walker, in reply to which I beg to mention, that of all my own works I have not even a priva...

div.p: E74/15264, unit 765, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I feel honored with your kind lines, dear Mr. Walker, in reply to which I beg to mention, that of all my own works I have not even a private copy myself, as they are available only at the Gov. Printer's Office. Of 2 volumes I happened to have a private copy, which I gladly place at your reverend friend's disposal.

Allow me to suggest, that an application be made to Mr Service for a set of the volumes issued by me, as far as still available. I feel convinced, that the honorable gentleman will at once accede to the request for so good a purpose and made by so influential a member of the Legislature as yourself.

The Acclimation Societys volumes contain also essays of mine, but I believe the supplies of copies, — except those of the last volume —, are exhausted. In a like manner the volumes of lectures, delivered at the Industrial Museum, as well as the Reports on the Exhibitions of 1862 & 1867 are now very difficult of access. But perhaps a trustee of the library might yet procure a set.

Allow me to express on this occasion my grateful recognition of the generous manner, in which you, dear Mr. Walker, always supported my Department in Parliament. Altho' the anomalous position of the Gov. Botanist out of the bot. Garden still continues, yet I look since last night more hopeful into the future, in as much as the promised increase of the vote of working expenses will allow me at least to rent an office-building, to engage a field collector and to add to the museum material for our literary and industrial purposes.
